prediction: Abstraction layer adds complexity without proportional value. As LLM APIs stabilize and models get better at function calling, the framework becomes overhead. Teams will increasingly go direct.
indicators: Major production users publicly migrating away
Core team pivoting to adjacent products (LangSmith)
notes: LangSmith pivot confirms the framework itself isn't the monetizable product. Watching GitHub commit velocity and enterprise adoption numbers.

target: Prompt Engineering as a Job Title
prediction: As models improve at understanding intent, the skill ceiling for prompting drops. "Prompt engineer" becomes a feature of every role, not a standalone position. Job listings will decline by 60% within 18 months.
indicators: Job listing volume for "prompt engineer" on LinkedIn/Indeed
Companies removing dedicated prompt engineering roles
Models requiring less prompt sophistication for same output quality
notes: Already seeing consolidation. Prompt engineering is being absorbed into existing roles rather than hired for separately. LinkedIn postings down ~30% from peak.

prediction: Startups whose entire value is a UI on top of an API call will fail as model providers add native features. The moat was never the wrapper — it was the data flywheel most wrappers don't have.
indicators: OpenAI/Anthropic releasing native features that match wrapper functionality
VC funding declining for wrapper-category startups
Churn rates increasing as users realize they can do it themselves
notes: ChatGPT Canvas, Claude Artifacts, Gemini extensions — every provider is eating the wrapper category. Series A funding for wrappers dropped significantly in Q4 2025.

prediction: Spaces was a great demo platform but production workloads are moving to dedicated infrastructure. The gap between "demo" and "production" deployment is widening, not closing.
indicators: Enterprise teams migrating to dedicated hosting
HF investing more in enterprise features than Spaces improvements
notes: Still popular for demos and research. The question is whether it stays relevant for anything beyond that. Modal and Replicate gaining traction in the production-but-easy space.
